intro: Leysera incana, commonly known as the hairy leysera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its native arid environments. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Leysera incana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in dry conditions.
